{{Infobox civil conflict | title = Zvartnots Airport clash | partof = the [[Karabakh movement]] | image = | caption = | date = July 5, 1988 | place = [[Zvartnots Airport]], [[Armenian Soviet Socialist Republic|Armenia]], [[Soviet Union]] | result = | side1 = {{flagdeco|Armenian SSR}} Armenian protesters | side2 = {{flagicon image|Red Army flag.svg}} [[Soviet Army]] | howmany1 = | howmany2 = | fatalities = 1<ref name="Beissinger"/><ref name="Verluise"/> | injuries = 36<ref name="Beissinger"/>–50<ref name="Verluise"/> }}
The '''Zvartnots Airport clash''' occurred on July 5, 1988 between Armenian protesters and the Soviet troops at the [[Zvartnots International Airport]] at the outskirts of [[Yerevan]].
After the Communist Party of the Soviet Union conference in late June disapproved the Armenian demands to Nagorno-Karabakh, a new wave of demonstrations erupted in Yerevan. The Soviet government sent troops to Yerevan to "restore order." Thousands of Armenian protesters gathered at the Zvartnots Airport to block the entrance of the Soviet troops. A clash occurred between the troops and the demonstrators. The security forces opened fire killing one person and injuring dozens.<ref name="Beissinger">{{cite book|last=Beissinger|first=Mark R.|title=Nationalist Mobilization and the Collapse of the Soviet State|year=2002|publisher=Cambridge University Press|isbn=9780521001489|page=187}}</ref><ref name="Verluise">{{cite book|last=Verluise|first=Pierre|title=Armenia in Crisis: The 1988 Earthquake|year=1995|publisher=Wayne State University Press|isbn=9780814325278|pages=92–93}}</ref> The event spread some [[anti-Soviet]] sentiment in Armenia.<ref name="Verluise"/><ref>{{cite book|last=Cohen|first=Ariel|title=Russian Imperialism: Development and Crisis|year=1998|publisher=Greenwood Publishing Group|isbn=9780275964818|page=135}}</ref>
